newsitem.title: USA: Chris Iggo named BZW chief economist in U.S..
newsitem.headline: Chris Iggo named BZW chief economist in U.S..

text.p: BZW Securities Inc named Chris Iggo as chief economist for North America, Iggo said Thursday.
He replaces former chief financial economist Steven Ricchiuto and senior economist Waldo Best, who left the firm on Wednesday for Dean Witter Reynolds Inc.

"In the interim, I will be doing both jobs, but eventually, we will be looking to rebuild a team (of economists)," Iggo told Reuters, adding that there has been no talk of additional hiring at this point.
Iggo has been an international economist at BZW since July, after spending seven years as an economist at Chase Manhattan Bank.
He will be working in New York and said he will primarily be responsible for economic research for fixed income, foreign exchange and derivatives.
